SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent.misc

Class User

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.misc.User
Direct Known Subclasses:
Admin, Entrant, Organizer
public class User extends Object
Domain model representing an app user and related operations.

Provides convenience methods for event discovery (filtering by tags), reading notifications, and persisting user preferences (e.g., notification opt-in). Firebase CRUD operations are delegated to FirebaseService wrappers for the corresponding roots.

Firebase roots used:
  • User — user profile and preferences
  • Event — event catalog (read for filtering)
  • Notification — per-user notification tree

Note: This class does not enforce authorization; callers should ensure appropriate access control before invoking read/write operations tied to a user.

    • filterEvents

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<ArrayList<String>> filterEvents(ArrayList<String> filterList, String filterAvailability)
      Returns a list of event IDs whose tags match any of the provided filter tokens.

      The filter is applied against each event's tag field (space-separated tokens).

      Parameters:
      filterList - case-sensitive tokens to match against event tags
      Returns:
      a task resolving to a list of matching event IDs

    • getNotificationList

      Reads the user's notifications from Firebase and materializes them into Notification objects.
      Returns:
      a task resolving to the user's notifications

    • updateProfile

      public boolean updateProfile(String name, String email, String phone, boolean notification)
      Updates the user's profile in Firebase Realtime Database.

      Validates input fields, updates local instance state, and persists changes to the /User/{userId} node using only the fields that are being updated.

      Validation Rules:

      • userId must be non-null and non-empty
      • name and email must be non-null and non-empty after trimming
      • phone is optional; if provided, it is trimmed
      • notification is stored as-is
      Parameters:
      name - the new display name (required)
      email - the new email address (required)
      phone - the new phone number (optional, may be null)
      notification - whether push notifications are enabled
      Returns:
      a Task that completes successfully if the update is sent to Firebase, or fails with an exception if validation fails or Firebase reports an error

    • createMockUser

      public void createMockUser()

    • isAdmin

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> isAdmin()
      Indicates whether this user is an admin. Default implementation returns false.
      Returns:
      false unless overridden by a derived type

    • isOrganizer

      public Boolean isOrganizer()
      Indicates whether this user is an organizer. Default implementation returns false.
      Returns:
      false unless overridden by a derived type

    • isBannedFromOrganizer

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> isBannedFromOrganizer()
      Checks if this user is banned from creating events as an organizer.
      Returns:
      a Task that resolves to true if the user is banned, false otherwise

    • setBannedFromOrganizer

      public void setBannedFromOrganizer(boolean banned)
      Sets the banned from organizer status locally (does not persist to Firebase). Use Admin.banUserFromOrganizer() or Admin.unbanUserFromOrganizer() to persist changes.
      Parameters:
      banned - whether the user should be banned from organizing
